name: Deaths in 2003 - Part 1 Quiz | Death Becomes Them | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Idi Amin.

	Amin was ousted from Uganda in 1979, after killing 300,000 people in the country.  He left the country in social and economical devastation.  He died in Saudi Arabia on August 16.

questions.text: What low-baritoned voice and Grammy winning R&B singer died on July 4th?
questions.explanation:
Barry White.

	White was famous for songs including, "Can't get enough of your love, babe".

questions.text: Which actor who had character names such as Barnaby and Jed, died on July 6th?
questions.explanation:
Buddy Ebsen.

	Buddy died at the age of 95.  He danced on Broadway for decades before landing the Jed Clampett (Beverly Hillbillies) role in 1962.  He was originally cast as the 'Tin Man' on the infamous "Wizard of Oz", but was allergic to the aluminum-based make-up.

questions.text: I was in show business for 65 years before I died at age 76.  I starred in shows such as, "Our Miss Brooks", "The Real McCoys", and many "Rambo" movies.  Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Richard Crenna.

	Crenna's roles went from radio to television, from a squeaky-voiced kid to an Army Colonel.  He died in January.

questions.text: Which actor who seemed to always have a 'death wish', died on August 30th, 2003?
questions.explanation:
Charles Bronson.

	Bronson was in many movies, but most famous for his series of "Death Wish".  He was 81.

questions.text: Which NBC broadcast journalist died in Iraq?
questions.explanation:
David Bloom.

	Bloom covered the war for NBC, CNBC, and MSNBC.  He died of a blood clot.

questions.text: Which German-born Nobel Prize winner died?
questions.explanation:
Bernard Katz.

	Katz won the Nobel Prize in physiology and medicine, for his work with how the nerves and muscles receive and transmit signals.  He won the award in 1970, and died April 20, 2003.

questions.text: Which "Three's Company" star died at the age of 54, due to an aortic dissection?
questions.explanation:
John Ritter.

	Ritter played Jack Tripper on the television series.  He was a star on the series, "8 Simple Rules for Dating My Teenage Daughter", when he passed away.

questions.text: What former NBA player, who became a 24 year old NBA coach, died on May 14th?
questions.explanation:
Dave DeBusschere.

	DeBusschere won 2 NBA titles with the New York Knicks.  He was also the youngest person to coach a NBA team in 1962, at the age of 24 with the Detroit Pistons.  He was also the last commissioner of the American Basketball Association before it combined with the NBA.

questions.text: What star of, "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood", died in February 2003?
questions.explanation:
Fred Rogers.

	Rogers' show ran 33 years on PBS.  He died at the age of 74.
